On Sat, Apr 7, 2012 at 00:36, Markus La=
nthaler <markus.lanthaler@...> wrote:
> Hi William,
>
> Looks to be an =
interesting "project".
>
>
>> Now, please bear in mind this is
>> not a com=
petition, where higher level means that framework wins. As
>> stated in the=
 article, even level 1 fully supports REST, only the
>> developer may need =
to do some extra work to get there. What we are
>> looking for is evaluatin=
g the frameworks in a way that helps the
>> framework makers and the users =
to identify the needs and solutions. It
>> is like suggesting a tool and te=
sting it in the field for tuning.
>
> It's quite normal that people use tho=
se levels as ranking. I think it would
> make the intention much clearer if=
 you would create a matrix instead of
> using these (maturity) levels. So, =
e.g., framework X has support for routing
> and media types whereas framewo=
rk Y has hypermedia/semantics support.
>
> You can't do that that easily wi=
th levels. Framework X is on level 3 and 5??
> Is it then also on 4? What a=
bout 1 and 2 then? But maybe it's too late to
> change that as the article =
has already been published..
>
>
>
> --
> Markus Lanthaler
> @markuslanthal=
er
